titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Photo collection of an historical tourist, 1920s - 1940s.
titlestmt.author: Pamela Cooley

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created with EADitor by user nycoofam.

did.unittitle: Photo collection of an historical tourist, 1920s - 1940s.
did.abstract: This collection contains photos taken and research done in the 1920s -1940s by a traveler with a deep interest in New York State history. Images of the following regions: the Adirondacks, Capitol, Catskill, Hudson and Mohawk River Valley, greater New York City, Long Island, and Niagara; and of the 1939 New York World’s Fair are included.

processinfo.p: The processing, cataloging, and encoding of this collection were made possible by a grant from the Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

accessrestrict.p: Coll. No. 464 is open for research according to the regulations of Fenimore Art Museum Library.

bioghist.p: Note from the donor who in 2012, lived in Tequesta, FL: this collection came "from a friend of my father-in-law…who apparently loved to travel to historical sites."
bioghist.head: Biography/History

controlaccess.subject: Historic house museums, --New York (State)--Photographs

New York World's Fair (1939-1940)--New York, N.Y.

scopecontent.p: This collection contains photos taken and research done in the 1920s -1940s by a traveler with a deep interest in New York State history. Images of the following regions: the Adirondacks, Capitol, Catskill, Hudson and Mohawk River Valley, greater New York City, Long Island, and Niagara; and of the 1939 New York World’s Fair are included.
scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 156 black & white photos in Folder 1, ca. 1924-1948, capture New York State historical sites, places, monuments and markers from Ft. Niagara to Montauk Point, including the Adirondacks, Capitol, Catskill, Hudson and Mohawk River Valley, greater New York City, Long Island, and Niagara regions of New York State. The photos are well-labeled with dates, locations, and provide context and historical notes.
Folder 2 contains black & white photos taken of the New York World’s Fair (May 1939 through its last day, September 27, 1940). About half the photos are labeled with date and subject of image.

Folder 3 contains an album of photographs (1924) of historical sites and places on Long and Staten Islands, Manhattan, Brooklyn and Flushing. They are labeled with dates, locations, and some historical notes.

userestrict.p: The copyright law of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) governs the making of photocopies or other reproductions of copyrighted material. userestrict.head: Use Restriction
